### AddDefaultSrcDestOperands() {#af3ed5ab1b0b8b2202e2ee943e50a2869}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void X86AsmParser::AddDefaultSrcDestOperands (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a61e27c75c3334cffa54c44c02077da1e">OperandVector</a> &amp; Operands, std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcparsedasmoperand">llvm::MCParsedAsmOperand</a> &gt; &amp;&amp; Src, std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcparsedasmoperand">llvm::MCParsedAsmOperand</a> &gt; &amp;&amp; Dst)</>}>

### applyLVICFIMitigation() {#af831e82d6f199baa2deae827083e8d5f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void X86AsmParser::applyLVICFIMitigation (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &amp; Inst, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcstreamer">MCStreamer</a> &amp; Out)</>}>
RET instructions and also instructions that indirect calls/jumps from memory combine a load and a branch within a single instruction.

To mitigate these instructions against LVI, they must be decomposed into separate load and branch instructions, with an LFENCE in between. For more details, see:
<ul>
<li><a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86loadvalueinjectionrethardening-cpp">X86LoadValueInjectionRetHardening.cpp</a></li>
<li>X86LoadValueInjectionIndirectThunks.cpp</li>
<li><a href="https://software.intel.com/security-software-guidance/insights/deep-dive-load-value-injection">https://software.intel.com/security-software-guidance/insights/deep-dive-load-value-injection</a></li>
</ul>


Returns <code>true</code> if a mitigation was applied or warning was emitted.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/lib/target/x86/asmparser/x86asmparser-cpp/#l01190">1190</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/lib/target/x86/asmparser/x86asmparser-cpp">X86AsmParser.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### applyLVILoadHardeningMitigation() {#a0cb26a0247ac5384de74d041cc83e734}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void X86AsmParser::applyLVILoadHardeningMitigation (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &amp; Inst, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcstreamer">MCStreamer</a> &amp; Out)</>}>
To mitigate LVI, every instruction that performs a load can be followed by an LFENCE instruction to squash any potential mis-speculation.

There are some instructions that require additional considerations, and may requre manual mitigation. For more details, see: <a href="https://software.intel.com/security-software-guidance/insights/deep-dive-load-value-injection">https://software.intel.com/security-software-guidance/insights/deep-dive-load-value-injection</a>

Returns <code>true</code> if a mitigation was applied or warning was emitted.

### ParseIntelInlineAsmOperator() {#a7543efc279ad8cb37a0bea98541f9e50}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned X86AsmParser::ParseIntelInlineAsmOperator (unsigned OpKind)">
Parse the &#39;LENGTH&#39;, &#39;TYPE&#39; and &#39;SIZE&#39; operators.

The LENGTH operator returns the number of elements in an array. It returns the value 1 for non-array variables. The SIZE operator returns the size of a C or C++ variable. A variable&#39;s size is the product of its LENGTH and TYPE. The TYPE operator returns the size of a C or C++ type or variable. If the variable is an array, TYPE returns the size of a single element.

### ParseMasmOperator() {#ad2e4fb8440ed61ce6577dec0e459ad6f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool X86AsmParser::ParseMasmOperator (unsigned OpKind, int64&#95;t &amp; Val)</>}>
Parse the &#39;LENGTHOF&#39;, &#39;SIZEOF&#39;, and &#39;TYPE&#39; operators.

The LENGTHOF operator returns the number of elements in an array. It returns the value 1 for non-array variables. The SIZEOF operator returns the size of a type or variable in bytes. A variable&#39;s size is the product of its LENGTH and TYPE. The TYPE operator returns the size of a variable. If the variable is an array, TYPE returns the size of a single element.

### ParseDirective {#a605f317c5671abb87131f5dcb6b2fe4a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool X86AsmParser::ParseDirective (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/asmtoken">AsmToken</a> DirectiveID)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
ParseDirective - Parse a target specific assembler directive This method is deprecated, use &#39;parseDirective&#39; instead.

The parser is positioned following the directive name. The target specific directive parser should parse the entire directive doing or recording any target specific work, or return true and do nothing if the directive is not target specific. If the directive is specific for the target, the entire line is parsed up to and including the end-of-statement token and false is returned.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="DirectiveID">- the identifier token of the directive.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/lib/target/x86/asmparser/x86asmparser-cpp/#l01295">1295</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/lib/target/x86/asmparser/x86asmparser-cpp">X86AsmParser.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### parseInstruction {#abf6230cdb8093ea54524821d036b2203}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool X86AsmParser::parseInstruction (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/parseinstructioninfo">ParseInstructionInfo</a> &amp; Info, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Name, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smloc">SMLoc</a> NameLoc, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a61e27c75c3334cffa54c44c02077da1e">OperandVector</a> &amp; Operands)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Parse one assembly instruction.

The parser is positioned following the instruction name. The target specific instruction parser should parse the entire instruction and construct the appropriate MCInst, or emit an error. On success, the entire line should be parsed up to and including the end-of-statement token. On failure, the parser is not required to read to the end of the line. 
<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Name">- The instruction name.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="NameLoc">- The source location of the name.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Operands">&#91;out&#93; - The list of parsed operands, this returns ownership of them to the caller.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
True on failure.
</SectionUser>
